doc.title: CSS 參考文件

value.content: Use this CSS reference to browse an alphabetical index of all the standard CSS properties, pseudo-classes, pseudo-elements (en-US), data types (en-US), and at-rules (en-US). You can also browse a list of all the CSS selectors organized by type and a list of key CSS concepts. Also included is a brief DOM-CSS / CSSOM reference.

value.title: Style rule syntax
value.content:
selectorlist {
  property: value;
  [more property:value; pairs]
}

... where selectorlist is: selector[:pseudo-class] [::pseudo-element] [, more selectorlists]

See selector, pseudo-class, pseudo-element lists below.

Style rule examples

strong {
  color: red;
}

div.menu-bar li:hover > ul {
  display: block;
}

For a beginner-level introduction to the syntax of CSS selectors, please see this tutorial. Be aware that any CSS syntax error in a rule definition invalidates the entire rule. Invalid rules are ignored by the browser. Note that CSS rule definitions are entirely (ASCII) text-based, whereas DOM-CSS / CSSOM (the rule management system) is object-based.

value.title: At-rule syntax
value.content: As the structure of at-rules varies widely, please see At-rule (en-US) to find the syntax of the specific one you want.

value.title: Basic selectors
value.content:
• Type selector elementname
  • Class selector (en-US) .classname
  • ID selector (en-US) #idname
  • Universal selector (en-US) *, ns|*, *|*, |*
  • Attribute selector (en-US) [attr=value]

value.title: Combinators
value.content:
• Adjacent sibling combinator (en-US) A + B
  • General sibling combinator (en-US) A ~ B
  • Child combinator (en-US) A > B
  • Descendant combinator A B

  • Shorthand properties

value.content:
• document.styleSheets (en-US)

  • cssRules[i].cssText (en-US) (selector & style)
  • cssRules[i].selectorText (en-US)
  • elem.style (en-US)
  • elem.style.cssText (en-US) (just style)
  • elem.className (en-US)
  • elem.classList

value.title: Important methods
value.content:
• CSSStyleSheet.insertRule
  • CSSStyleSheet.deleteRule (en-US)

value.title: See also
value.content:
• Mozilla CSS extensions (en-US) (prefixed with -moz)
  • WebKit CSS extensions (en-US) (mostly prefixed with -webkit)
  • Microsoft CSS extensions (en-US) (prefixed with -ms)

doc.summary: Use this CSS reference to browse an alphabetical index of all the standard CSS properties, pseudo-classes, pseudo-elements (en-US), data types (en-US), and at-rules (en-US). You can also browse a list of all the CSS selectors organized by type and a list of key CSS concepts. Also included is a brief DOM-CSS / CSSOM reference.
